programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In nature, the prevailing rule is ‚Äòeat or be eaten.‚Äô Avoiding predators and competition for space, food, and mates is a priority for every animal. But before you can attack, you need to be able to defend yourself. programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds reveals some highly questionable parenting strategies from the animal kingdom‚Äôs worst parents, the underdogs. From a goose who lays their eggs on the top of a cliff to a koala that feeds its baby poop, it‚Äôs uncertain if they bad parents or just misunderstood. But no matter how bad one thinks they may be at parenting; they can‚Äôt be as bad as these guys.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals survive by using camouflage, mimicry, and stealth tactics. From tigers who hunt in plain sight using their orange fur as camouflage, and a spider who mimics an ant to sneak into a colony, to a bird that uses false alarm calls to trick meerkats into giving up their prey, nature deploys remarkable deception to survive.

programme.desc: Two bear cubs recovering from a harrowing experience need Dr. Oakley's expertise as they embark on a long journey to a new home. A cat's extreme mouth ulcers cause worry for its owner, but Dr. Oakley knows just what to do. What should be an easy surgery may just leave Rusty the Labrador Retriever breathless. Two baby goats are in need of castrations and Dr. Oakley and her daughters go swimming with horses.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads to the mysterious blue depths to discover which animal dominates the sea. His first encounter is with a tiger shark, the notorious hunter shaped like a torpedo and armed with ferocious teeth! Next, Phil dives with a group of magnificent manta rays and listens to the songs of one of the largest creatures on Earth, the majestic humpback whale.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It's the county fair season! The Pol‚Äôs plan to get at least two cows and six sheep at the auction, but they have a lot to do before that can happen. First up, they must install a new perimeter fence. Charles and Ben think they are off to a good start, but when Dr. Pol points out how sneaky sheep can be, their workload doubles. Meanwhile, Beth is hoping for a goat at the small animal auction.

programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: With winter quickly approaching, Dr. Oakley is busy working to prepare the animals of Alaska and the Yukon for the cold. Dental damage is no trouble for an old horse with a history of being a survivor. Another horse's mysterious nosebleed needs a deeper look. .

programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck as Dr. Oakley castrates a once wild stallion. Then, everyone holds their breath to see if the newly gelded horse succeeded in getting three mares pregnant before winter. What is thought to be a benign cyst on Curly the dog may be more serious than her owner thought. .

programme.title: Untamed Philippines
programme.desc: Moving from turtles of the Palawan coast to the unique National Marine Park at Tubbataha, to meet giants, whale sharks and manta rays. We also see how people can mediate between people and wildlife as we join a snake hunting team catching and translocating a deadly Samar cobra.

programme.title: Africa's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: Blanketed by mists and bordered by dense jungles filled with rampaging beasts, Rwanda is a country cloaked in mystery. This tropical land of fire and forest lies at the crest of the mountainous backbone of Africa. Home to the African great apes and some of the continent's most mysterious landscapes - from the Virunga volcanoes, to rich rainforest to exploding lakes.

programme.title: Australia's Land of the Ancients
programme.desc: Australias Land of the Ancients explores the unique and ancient landscape of northeastern Australia, the most biodiverse region on the continent. From Crocodiles lying in wait for fish and hunting feral pigs to caring marsupial mothers of the far north, the film highlights some of the incredible species as they struggle to survive in their harsh environment amid a changing landscape.

programme.title: Untamed Philippines
